abstract: Greetings from Davos, Switzerland, home of the annual conference of the World Economic Forum. Wall Street chief executives and private equity kings are here aplenty: Lloyd Blankfein of Goldman Sachs, Jamie Dimon of J.P. Morgan Chase, Charles Prince of Citigroup, Stephen Schwarzman of Blackstone Group and David Rubenstein of Carlyle Group, just to name a few. Several panels on this week’s agenda should provide some interesting grist for dealmakers, including “Is Bigger Better in Private Equity?” and “The M&A Landscape: Developing the 2007 Heatmap.”
lead_paragraph: Greetings from Davos, Switzerland, home of the annual conference of the World Economic Forum. Wall Street chief executives and private equity kings are here aplenty: Lloyd Blankfein of Goldman Sachs, Jamie Dimon of J.P. Morgan Chase, Charles Prince of Citigroup, Stephen Schwarzman of Blackstone Group and David Rubenstein of Carlyle Group, just to name a few. Several panels on this week’s agenda should provide some interesting grist for dealmakers, including “Is Bigger Better in Private Equity?” and “The M&A Landscape: Developing the 2007 Heatmap.”
